(see answer) Asked on: Disney Princess - Bassinet See all Walmart Questions and Answers > BABY NURSERY Q&A > CRIBS Q&A > BASSINETS AND CRADLES Q&A Customer Questions&Answers for The First Years The First Years - Carry-Me-Near 5-in-1 Baby Bassinet The First Years bassinet for your baby is a portable sleeper, bassinet, bedside sleeper, play seat and changing table all in one. The First Years 5-in-1 bassinet has a strong handle that lets you carry your sleeping baby from one room to another. With a sturdy base, this baby bassinet can either rock back and forth or lock into place. Customer Questions&Answers: 66 Questions | 120 Answers Ask a New Question Overall Rating: 4.4 out of 5 Read All 296 Reviews 269 Choose a sort order Questions With the Most Helpful Answers Most Recent Questions Oldest Questions Questions With Most Recent Answers Questions With Oldest Answers Questions With Most Answers Can You Answer These Questions? Questions&Answers for The First Years The First Years - Carry-Me-Near 5-in-1 Baby Bassinet Question can u autually rock it back and fourth like a cradle? asked 3 years, 5 months ago By an anonymous customer - belen on The First Years - Carry-Me-Near 5-in-1 Baby Bassinet 2 answers Answers answer 1 Yes, it has cradle type legs answered 1 year, 10 months ago By NBey - Philadelphia, PA answer 2 The Bassinet will rock with the wheels retracted or not rock with the wheels down and locked as you wish. Chaging back and forth is a breeze and takes just seconds with no tools necessary. It rocks side to side. You must rock it by hand tho, not automatic. answered 3 years, 5 months ago By GrandmaPenny - Wenatchee, WA Question Do the plush charaters that dangle detatch? asked 3 years, 4 months ago By an anonymous customer on The First Years - Carry-Me-Near 5-in-1 Baby Bassinet 2 answers Answers answer 1 yes they are attatched by a velcro loop answered 1 year, 8 months ago By jenisangel2007 - seattle, wa answer 2 yes they do, but the string part that they hang on don't so when you detach them you just have the characters and a small ring at the top where they attach to something. answered 3 years, 4 months ago By eeyorelover05 - Missouri Question Can you purchase and replace bedding? asked 3 years, 1 month ago By kferris209 on The First Years - Carry-Me-Near 5-in-1 Baby Bassinet 2 answers Answers answer 1 Yes, but you have to order it directly from Learning Center website. For $4.99 plus shipping and handling. You get a replacement sheet and mattress pad. answered 2 years, 2 months ago By hchawley - Idaho answer 2 yes you can you can buy just regular bassinet bedding. you wont be able to put the buckle in it for a play seat but if you want different bedding to have just in case of spit up in the middle of the night regular bassinet bedding will work answered 3 years ago By babylove1215 - jamestown,ca Question what type of batteries does it require asked 2 years, 11 months ago By 1030 on The First Years - Carry-Me-Near 5-in-1 Baby Bassinet 2 answers Answers answer 1 AA answered 1 year, 10 months ago By NBey - Philadelphia, PA answer 2 It requires AA batteries. answered 2 years, 11 months ago By Texmom01 - Texas Question I am expecting twin Grandbabies; a boy and a girl. Does product come in any other colors but beige? asked 2 years, 9 months ago By lazyway - Indialantic, FL on The First Years - Carry-Me-Near 5-in-1 Baby Bassinet 2 answers Answers answer 1 No only beige, Top 1000 Contributor answered 1 year, 6 months ago By MrsC2012 - Spokane WA answer 2 Not that I saw. The l ight and music is a plus answered 2 years, 7 months ago By NewGrandmother1007 - Lincoln MI Question How much weigh does it hold? asked 2 years, 4 months ago By valerie8464 on The First Years - Carry-Me-Near 5-in-1 Baby Bassinet 2 answers Answers answer 1 in the manual it says to stop using when baby is 17.5lbs. answered 1 year, 8 months ago By jenisangel2007 - seattle, wa answer 2 it says on the product that you can put your baby in it until he or she can push themselves up on their bellies unassisted or up to 17.5 pounds whichever comes first. answered 2 years, 2 months ago By sassygrl06 Question Does this bassinet have wheels? asked 2 years, 2 months ago By an anonymous customer on The First Years - Carry-Me-Near 5-in-1 Baby Bassinet 2 answers Answers answer 1 yes answered 1 year, 10 months ago By NBey - Philadelphia, PA answer 2 Yes, with a braking button so it can't move when stationary. answered 2 years, 2 months ago By hchawley - Idaho Question Is the height adjustable? asked 2 years ago By khollow on The First Years - Carry-Me-Near 5-in-1 Baby Bassinet 2 answers Answers answer 1 Yes, the bassinet is adjustable. It has several settings to choose from. answered 1 year, 8 months ago By Becca419 - PA answer 2 Yes it is and it will lock into different height positions. answered 2 years ago By OttumwaMomOfThree - Ottumwa, Iowa Question What kind of batteries does this take? I read that rechargeables do not work. asked 1 year, 11 months ago By an anonymous customer on The First Years - Carry-Me-Near 5-in-1 Baby Bassinet 2 answers Answers answer 1 If I am remembering correct, AA answered 1 year, 10 months ago By NBey - Philadelphia, PA answer 2 4 AA batteries answered 1 year, 10 months ago By Havreitte - Havre, MT Question I have lost it's user manual, and I cannot assemble the Vinyl covered changing table part of the bassinet. I have lost it's user manual, and I cannot assemble the Vinyl covered changing table part of the bassinet. I searched for the user manual online but unable to find one. Can I please get the manual or information on how to assemble the changing table part of the bassinet? asked 1 year, 9 months ago By an anonymous customer on The First Years - Carry-Me-Near 5-in-1 Baby Bassinet 2 answers Answers answer 1 Contact The First Years customer service, and I'm sure they can help you. answered 1 year, 4 months ago By meand8 - Madison Heights, VA answer 2 I can email the instructions to if you cannot read them. The last part of the instrucs are as follows since I can only post two pics.. 5. Squeeze rod supports into place make sure they are firmly inserted into holes in stand. 6. Snap brackets over fabric supports. Align holes and push short screw into place secure with nut using pliers 7. Wrap velcro fasteners around fabric support tubes and foam pad doing center one last, repeat for other side. 8. Pull fabric over and straighten ruffle.
